Tests whether a certain [[block]] is in a specific location.

==Syntax==

: <code>testforblock <position: x y z> <tileName: Block> [blockStates: block states]</code>

==Arguments==

{{argument|be=1|position: x y z |CommandPosition}}
: Specifies the [[coordinates]] of the block to test.
: {{arg desc|be=CommandPosition}}

{{argument|be=1|tileName: Block|enum}}
: Specifies the block to test for.
: {{arg desc|be=Block}}

{{argument|be=1|blockStates: block states|BlockStateCommandParam}}
: Specifies the [[block states]] to match when testfor.
: {{Arg desc|be=BlockStateCommandParam}}

== Result ==

{{Result table|onlybe=1}}
{{Result table|The command is incomplete, or any argument is not specified correctly.||unparseable}}
{{Result table|The specified position is unloaded or out of the world.||fail}}
{{Result table|The block at the specified position does not match the specified block id or states.}}
{{Result table|succeed}}
{{Result table}}

{{Output table|onlybe=1}}

{{Output table|On success|1}}
{{Output table}}

==Examples==

* To test if the block at (0,64,0) is [[white wool]]:
** <code>testforblock 0 64 0 wool</code>
** <code>testforblock 0 64 0 white_wool</code>
* To test if the block at (0,64,0) is [[stone]]:
** <code>testforblock 0 64 0 stone []</code>
* To test if the block below is a [[jukebox]]:
** <code>testforblock ~ ~-1 ~ jukebox</code>
